name: Alisha A.
text: The staff is awesome and the facility is well kept. Just love it!!!  Highly recommend.

name: Dr.David Callaway
text: Wonderful place,Very clean. Staff is very nice and helpful. The therapy is the best around.They look after all my needs.The food is really good as well. They treat there residents with respect, and honor.The rooms are nice too.

name: Mary Folsom
text: Such nice folks! I came here after my knee replacement and the therapy was top notch!

name: laura hough
text: I've worked at this facility for 2.5 years and have loved it the entire time. The staff is very friendly, ED is very accommodating, therapies are excellent. The only reason for my resignation is because my husband is now travelling for work and I need to be closer to home. Otherwise, I would work here until retirement. The nursing staff is wonderful and accomodating. The ED has been updating the building and it looks very nice. Zero odors, ever. The food is good and hot when delivered on halls as staff completes test trays often to ensure palatability. The Food and Nutrition Manager is always implementing new programs to make the residents feel at home -- ice cream socials, homemade bread to make the dining room smell good, omelet and waffle stations. Overall this is a great facility and I would absolutely place my family member here if needed.

name: Bill Werner
text: Both my mother and father have been at this facility over the course of several years after falls at home.  Nice staff and a wonderful therapy team.  Best in Mobile.

name: Susan Bell
text: I moved my Mother from another facility to this one and am very glad I did.  Staff have been very nice and while we did have to wait on a private room, she has one now and they have been very accomodating in making it home like for her.  She has transitioned very easily and has made herself some friends that she visits with.  My family and I have been very pleased.

name: Krystal Bean
text: My grandmother was a patient here and she got great care.  The admissions staff was really nice and understanding and the nursing and therapy staff was amazing.  My family felt good knowing she was being taken care of.

name: Julie Peyton
text: This facility came highly recommended and it did not disappoint.  My mother was admitted after her hip surgery and the therapy was excellent.  I don't typically write reviews but was truly impressed with the care she was given.

name: Shannon Harris
text: We had a terrible experience with the night nurses. My 88 year old father was there for rehab and when I arrived at 5 am, I found his nurse call button in the chair where he couldn’t reach it. They had wrestled it away from him injuring (cutting)his finger and bruising him. They said that he kept pushing the button. Totally unacceptable. When I left the night before at 9 pm, I left his cell phone along with a pad that had my number and my brothers written down on the tray table next to his bed. When I got there, both had been moved to a desk in his room that again he couldn’t reach. I would hire a sitter if your loved one is ever has to be in this facility, especially at night. Beware of the night nurses. I have names of them if needed.

name: Joseph Knight
text: Nice people.  My siblings and I researched the facilities here in Mobile and this one is the best.

name: Tom Steele
text: Would not recommend. Nursing care was disappointing. The therapy was ok. Try another place.

name: Wade Willis
text: My Mom was at this facility for 20 days following her hip replacement.  The therapy was really good, everyone was friendly and she didn't have to share a room which she wouldn't like.

name: Jamie MeMe
text: Absolutely terrible experience; some staff is amazing only a small portion while other staff is horrific and shouldn't be taking care of people or anyone for that matter. Had an issue and staff never followed through. Without going into full details, I wouldn't put my worst enemy in this place. People incarcerated are treated better!  And how absolutely slow the staff is for emergency every minute counts! This place should shut down bottom line.

name: Jasmine McMillian
text: One of the best facilities in town!!! the staff were so helpful and kind. when i walked into this facility everyone greeted me as if ive known them a lifetime. The facility smelled wonderful and everything was so nice and pleseant. also the food was AMAZING and the Therapy department couldnt be any better , I would Highly recommend this facility !!!

name: Mike Jacobson
text: DO NOT PUT A LOVED ONE IN THIS FACILITY!!!!! CARE OF RESIDENTS IS TERRIBLE.  STATE VIOLATIONS AGAINST THIS FACILITY FOR FOOD TEMPERATURE, RECURRENCE OF UTI's WAY ABOVE NORMAL; FINES ASSESSED AGAINST FACILITY. LOOKS GOOD FROM OUTSIDE BUT WHEN YOU GET TO ROOMS (UNLESS DIRECTOR THERE IS EXPECTING YOU) ARE FILTHY. RESIDENTS ARE NOT LOOKED AT FREQUENTLY BY AIDS/NURSES.  UNFRIENDLY STAFF.  CHECKED STATE WEBSITE FOR THIS FACILITY, LOOKS LIKE THERE ARE MANY WHO HAVE FILED A CLAIM OF NEGLECT AND ARE REQUESTING FACILITY TO BE SHUT DOWN.

name: Betty Lassiter
text: Great therapy staff, I enjoyed the food as well.  Overall a good experience after my hip replacement.

name: Joyce Scarbrough
text: My MIL had to be transferred from assisted living to a nursing home because she was having multiple falls, was declining daily, and needed skilled nursing care, so we chose this place. We told them from the beginning that we had gotten a 30-day notice from the assisted living facility to complete the transfer. Dedra, the admissions director, was never in when we called and never returned even ONE of my more than a dozen phone calls. When I went to the facility in person, she was never there and her assistant, Paula, acted as if she was bored to tears by everything I said and could not have cared less about our problems. Finally, when we were on day 24 of our 30 days and Dedra still had not done the face-to-face interview with my MIL to determine if they could take her, we gave up and chose another nursing home. I've known people who had relatives at Mobile Nursing and Rehab who were very happy with the nursing care, but the administration and admissions personnel are terrible. They made an already painful and stressful time for us even worse.

name: Amanda Eubanks
text: I work here in housekeeping and I love the environment and the co-workers I love the genuine hospitality we have here and I absolutely love how we all work together to access the need of our residents they are our top priority!

name: artgirl
text:
my husband mike was in mnr from mays 31st to june 18, 2018...for rehab...they put him at the end of a long hallway...i think it was room 327...i donot recommend this snf to anyone...on the first day after mike was admitted he ended up being unresponsive and em people took him to providence...we were there 8 hours and we came back...during that night mike couldnt breathe he was on oxygen...so i ran up to the nurses station and got the male nurse on duty...i think his name was vic...not sure...he came up...and checked his line and it had popped off the concentrator...because the line coming from the humidifer was too long...so he cut off a section of it and put it back on and mike could breath...vic...said this happens all the time...mike and i thought this is what might have happened to him and why he landed in the hospital...it is no telling when anyone checked on him...we had problems with some of the nurses espcecially a ms andry...she was so incompetent...i started coming in all the time because i was afraid something would happen to mike...there is a federal law stating that you can visit your loved one at anytime...they tried to keep me from doing it...but i talked to the administrator and she told me i could come in at any time...it got so bad that i started sleeping on the floor because i was scared...i did that for 3 nights until they said it was a fire hazard...so i started sleeping in my truck...and it was a good thing as when i came in the morning...mike was becoming unresponsive and sick...noone had checked on him in 6 hours...too lazy to make that long walk down there...i guess...so we ended up in mobile infirmary again... another thing that happens was that a psychiatrist named florin ghelmez came in while mike was on a bed pan and i asked him to come back...and when he came back mike was still on the pan...so we never saw him again...i guess it was to do an evaluation...so when mike went to mobile infirmary on june 18th by emergency vehicle i came to the hospital...went into mikes cubicle in er...and i saw a manila envelope...i asked mike what it was and he said it was from mobile nursing and rehab...i looked thru it and i asked a pa if they would copy the documents...she said she couldnt so i decided to just keep them...when i went thru it i found documentation by dr. florin ghelmex which basically was all a lie...slanderous...he said he had talked to us both....that mike was an opiate user...that he was doctor shopping and that i was his enabler...so it told mike about it and i later talked to an attorney about it...we decided to file medicare fraud case against this doctor...but would wait till we saw whether he filed the bill...we got the medicare documents and he did file for payment...so we called medicare and filed a fraud case against him...mike and i both thought that mnr was in cahoots with him because in the document he said he had talked to a nurse about us...my husband was on Percocet and fenynal patches but under a doctor care...dr Christopher nichols at the orthopedic group...and had been for a long time...mike was constantly in pain...
i just got a letter from Medicare stating they are investigating the case... i came out of this facility one night and this lady was sitting in the chairs out front...she asked me what i thought of mnr...i told her that this place scared me...that i thought my husband needed to be in the hospital where he could get skilled care...she told me that her 90 something-year-old mother was there...and that she was in a shared room but no one was there and told her that she could sleep in the bed...they never offered that to me...and i was there every day and i even slept on the floor 3 nights...and i told them i was sleeping in my truck...they made no accommodation for me...mike needed me to be there with him...and i was really helpful to those people...i would change his sheets and clean him up so they wouldnt have to do it...but i stood up for mike...i am not the type of person that will allowed being walked over...

name: Helen Shirey
text: I have volunteered here since 2003 I ,I love the people and the place . When it is my time I will live my final days at this place.

name: Mary Cooper
text: wonderful people

name: Angie Thames
text: The absolute worse facility I have EVER been in. I walked into the door after being let in of course by a employee that Never greeted me not even so much a smile, .  I understand the nurse to patient ratio is moderatly high but this is unaccetable .  I pressed the call light and timed the aids to address the light and it was 25 minutes before it was answered.  My mother was in a halo of rine and there were no supplies in the room, she is a tube feeder and the aid tried to put her head down all the way until I reminder her that she was a tube feeder and that wasnt suppose to happen, no gloves no barrier and the trash was over flowing, the TV was off and lights were off in the room, I'd not recommend this facility to anyone other than the state and that would be under the suggestion to shut them down, VERY POOR QUALITY OF CARE BEWARE!!!

name: Jasmine Young
text: Friendly residents and staff

name: kayla buttram
text: I was an employee at this facility and the way they treat some of the patients is sad they don't change them like they are suppose to they yell at the patients put their hands on them

fraud case against him...mike and i both thought that mnr was in cahoots with him because in the document he said he had talked to a nurse about us...my husband was on Percocet and fenynal patches but under a doctor care...dr Christopher nichols at the orthopedic group...and had been for a long time...mike was constantly in pain...
i just got a letter from Medicare stating they are investigating the case... i came out of this facility one night and this lady was sitting in the chairs out front...she asked me what i thought of mnr...i told her that this place scared me...that i thought my husband needed to be in the hospital where he could get skilled care...she told me that her 90 something-year-old mother was there...and that she was in a shared room but no one was there and told her that she could sleep in the bed...they never offered that to me...and i was there every day and i even slept on the floor 3 nights...and i told them i was sleeping in my truck...they made no accommodation for me...mike needed me to be there with him...and i was really helpful to those people...i would change his sheets and clean him up so they wouldnt have to do it...but i stood up for mike...i am not the type of person that will allowed being walked over...

name: Helen Shirey
text: I have volunteered here since 2003 I ,I love the people and the place . When it is my time I will live my final days at this place.

name: Mary Cooper
text: wonderful people

name: Angie Thames
text: The absolute worse facility I have EVER been in. I walked into the door after being let in of course by a employee that Never greeted me not even so much a smile, .  I understand the nurse to patient ratio is moderatly high but this is unaccetable .  I pressed the call light and timed the aids to address the light and it was 25 minutes before it was answered.  My mother was in a halo of rine and there were no supplies in the room, she is a tube feeder and the aid tried to put her head down all the way until I reminder her that she was a tube feeder and that wasnt suppose to happen, no gloves no barrier and the trash was over flowing, the TV was off and lights were off in the room, I'd not recommend this facility to anyone other than the state and that would be under the suggestion to shut them down, VERY POOR QUALITY OF CARE BEWARE!!!

name: Jasmine Young
text: Friendly residents and staff

name: kayla buttram
text: I was an employee at this facility and the way they treat some of the patients is sad they don't change them like they are suppose to they yell at the patients put their hands on them

name: Alisha A.
text: The staff is awesome and the facility is well kept. Just love it!!!  Highly recommend.

name: Dr.David Callaway
text: Wonderful place,Very clean. Staff is very nice and helpful. The therapy is the best around.They look after all my needs.The food is really good as well. They treat there residents with respect, and honor.The rooms are nice too.

name: Mary Folsom
text: Such nice folks! I came here after my knee replacement and the therapy was top notch!

name: laura hough
text: I've worked at this facility for 2.5 years and have loved it the entire time. The staff is very friendly, ED is very accommodating, therapies are excellent. The only reason for my resignation is because my husband is now travelling for work and I need to be closer to home. Otherwise, I would work here until retirement. The nursing staff is wonderful and accomodating. The ED has been updating the building and it looks very nice. Zero odors, ever. The food is good and hot when delivered on halls as staff completes test trays often to ensure palatability. The Food and Nutrition Manager is always implementing new programs to make the residents feel at home -- ice cream socials, homemade bread to make the dining room smell good, omelet and waffle stations. Overall this is a great facility and I would absolutely place my family member here if needed.

name: Bill Werner
text: Both my mother and father have been at this facility over the course of several years after falls at home.  Nice staff and a wonderful therapy team.  Best in Mobile.

name: Susan Bell
text: I moved my Mother from another facility to this one and am very glad I did.  Staff have been very nice and while we did have to wait on a private room, she has one now and they have been very accomodating in making it home like for her.  She has transitioned very easily and has made herself some friends that she visits with.  My family and I have been very pleased.

name: Krystal Bean
text: My grandmother was a patient here and she got great care.  The admissions staff was really nice and understanding and the nursing and therapy staff was amazing.  My family felt good knowing she was being taken care of.

name: Julie Peyton
text: This facility came highly recommended and it did not disappoint.  My mother was admitted after her hip surgery and the therapy was excellent.  I don't typically write reviews but was truly impressed with the care she was given.

name: Shannon Harris
text: We had a terrible experience with the night nurses. My 88 year old father was there for rehab and when I arrived at 5 am, I found his nurse call button in the chair where he couldn’t reach it. They had wrestled it away from him injuring (cutting)his finger and bruising him. They said that he kept pushing the button. Totally unacceptable. When I left the night before at 9 pm, I left his cell phone along with a pad that had my number and my brothers written down on the tray table next to his bed. When I got there, both had been moved to a desk in his room that again he couldn’t reach. I would hire a sitter if your loved one is ever has to be in this facility, especially at night. Beware of the night nurses. I have names of them if needed.

name: Joseph Knight
text: Nice people.  My siblings and I researched the facilities here in Mobile and this one is the best.

name: Tom Steele
text: Would not recommend. Nursing care was disappointing. The therapy was ok. Try another place.

name: Wade Willis
text: My Mom was at this facility for 20 days following her hip replacement.  The therapy was really good, everyone was friendly and she didn't have to share a room which she wouldn't like.

name: Jamie MeMe
text: Absolutely terrible experience; some staff is amazing only a small portion while other staff is horrific and shouldn't be taking care of people or anyone for that matter. Had an issue and staff never followed through. Without going into full details, I wouldn't put my worst enemy in this place. People incarcerated are treated better!  And how absolutely slow the staff is for emergency every minute counts! This place should shut down bottom line.

name: Jasmine McMillian
text: One of the best facilities in town!!! the staff were so helpful and kind. when i walked into this facility everyone greeted me as if ive known them a lifetime. The facility smelled wonderful and everything was so nice and pleseant. also the food was AMAZING and the Therapy department couldnt be any better , I would Highly recommend this facility !!!

name: Mike Jacobson
text: DO NOT PUT A LOVED ONE IN THIS FACILITY!!!!! CARE OF RESIDENTS IS TERRIBLE.  STATE VIOLATIONS AGAINST THIS FACILITY FOR FOOD TEMPERATURE, RECURRENCE OF UTI's WAY ABOVE NORMAL; FINES ASSESSED AGAINST FACILITY. LOOKS GOOD FROM OUTSIDE BUT WHEN YOU GET TO ROOMS (UNLESS DIRECTOR THERE IS EXPECTING YOU) ARE FILTHY. RESIDENTS ARE NOT LOOKED AT FREQUENTLY BY AIDS/NURSES.  UNFRIENDLY STAFF.  CHECKED STATE WEBSITE FOR THIS FACILITY, LOOKS LIKE THERE ARE MANY WHO HAVE FILED A CLAIM OF NEGLECT AND ARE REQUESTING FACILITY TO BE SHUT DOWN.

name: Betty Lassiter
text: Great therapy staff, I enjoyed the food as well.  Overall a good experience after my hip replacement.

name: Joyce Scarbrough
text: My MIL had to be transferred from assisted living to a nursing home because she was having multiple falls, was declining daily, and needed skilled nursing care, so we chose this place. We told them from the beginning that we had gotten a 30-day notice from the assisted living facility to complete the transfer. Dedra, the admissions director, was never in when we called and never returned even ONE of my more than a dozen phone calls. When I went to the facility in person, she was never there and her assistant, Paula, acted as if she was bored to tears by everything I said and could not have cared less about our problems. Finally, when we were on day 24 of our 30 days and Dedra still had not done the face-to-face interview with my MIL to determine if they could take her, we gave up and chose another nursing home. I've known people who had relatives at Mobile Nursing and Rehab who were very happy with the nursing care, but the administration and admissions personnel are terrible. They made an already painful and stressful time for us even worse.

name: Amanda Eubanks
text: I work here in housekeeping and I love the environment and the co-workers I love the genuine hospitality we have here and I absolutely love how we all work together to access the need of our residents they are our top priority!

name: artgirl
text:
my husband mike was in mnr from mays 31st to june 18, 2018...for rehab...they put him at the end of a long hallway...i think it was room 327...i donot recommend this snf to anyone...on the first day after mike was admitted he ended up being unresponsive and em people took him to providence...we were there 8 hours and we came back...during that night mike couldnt breathe he was on oxygen...so i ran up to the nurses station and got the male nurse on duty...i think his name was vic...not sure...he came up...and checked his line and it had popped off the concentrator...because the line coming from the humidifer was too long...so he cut off a section of it and put it back on and mike could breath...vic...said this happens all the time...mike and i thought this is what might have happened to him and why he landed in the hospital...it is no telling when anyone checked on him...we had problems with some of the nurses espcecially a ms andry...she was so incompetent...i started coming in all the time because i was afraid something would happen to mike...there is a federal law stating that you can visit your loved one at anytime...they tried to keep me from doing it...but i talked to the administrator and she told me i could come in at any time...it got so bad that i started sleeping on the floor because i was scared...i did that for 3 nights until they said it was a fire hazard...so i started sleeping in my truck...and it was a good thing as when i came in the morning...mike was becoming unresponsive and sick...noone had checked on him in 6 hours...too lazy to make that long walk down there...i guess...so we ended up in mobile infirmary again... another thing that happens was that a psychiatrist named florin ghelmez came in while mike was on a bed pan and i asked him to come back...and when he came back mike was still on the pan...so we never saw him again...i guess it was to do an evaluation...so when mike went to mobile infirmary on june 18th by emergency vehicle i came to the hospital...went into mikes cubicle in er...and i saw a manila envelope...i asked mike what it was and he said it was from mobile nursing and rehab...i looked thru it and i asked a pa if they would copy the documents...she said she couldnt so i decided to just keep them...when i went thru it i found documentation by dr. florin ghelmex which basically was all a lie...slanderous...he said he had talked to us both....that mike was an opiate user...that he was doctor shopping and that i was his enabler...so it told mike about it and i later talked to an attorney about it...we decided to file medicare fraud case against this doctor...but would wait till we saw whether he filed the bill...we got the medicare documents and he did file for payment...so we called medicare and filed a fraud case against him...mike and i both thought that mnr was in cahoots with him because in the document he said he had talked to a nurse about us...my husband was on Percocet and fenynal patches but under a doctor care...dr Christopher nichols at the orthopedic group...and had been for a long time...mike was constantly in pain...
i just got a letter from Medicare stating they are investigating the case... i came out of this facility one night and this lady was sitting in the chairs out front...she asked me what i thought of mnr...i told her that this place scared me...that i thought my husband needed to be in the hospital where he could get skilled care...she told me that her 90 something-year-old mother was there...and that she was in a shared room but no one was there and told her that she could sleep in the bed...they never offered that to me...and i was there every day and i even slept on the floor 3 nights...and i told them i was sleeping in my truck...they made no accommodation for me...mike needed me to be there with him...and i was really helpful to those people...i would change his sheets and clean him up so they wouldnt have to do it...but i stood up for mike...i am not the type of person that will allowed being walked over...

text: AA meets here every morning at 6:30 am! Great meeting!

name: Gary Donohoo
text: Good bunch of friends of Bill W.

name: Bruce Jones
text: It is an absolute life saver for people like myself

name: Daniel Hannan
text: Saves lives

name: 3Two4L
text: Great hospitality and definitely make it a fun time while helping you recover! If there were 100 stars on here I’d give them 1000!

name: Derrick Griffie
text: The staff and leadership are very knowledgeable and does a great job of teaching you how to become effective in your own training and development. They partner with you to get you healed and teach you how to recognize when and if the problem may occur again. Love them so much!

name: Jean Cox
text:
The Therapist I have worked with exclusively has been Richard. He has been awesome to work with and pushes me but does take into consideration my overall pain level from  previous surgeries that has left me with chronic pain. The room and equipment is constantly being cleaned! Overall rating is definitely a *10+ I’ve also worked with another girl several times and she really pushes me to improve which I like!

This past week has definitely had its challenges.. flat tire and husband is disabled and couldn’t change the tire!

name: Montrice Lucas
text: Amazing therapist that are very courteous!!! Everyone works together to help the patients. The atmosphere is awesome! Everyone seems to love what they do and love working with each other! Not only that, the therapy is working!

name: Aimee Martin
text: Very flexible with school schedule!  My daughter feels like she is going to see her friends rather than a therapist. Great professionals who take the time to explain everything that they are doing. Getting my daughter better!!!

name: Cathy Fine
text: Trussville ATI Physical Therapy is absolutely wonderful! All the therapists and staff are so caring and really go the extra mile to help you.

name: Jan Sims
text: The best Therapists you will find. With their knowledge & pooling of information & modalities I have a chance to avoid surgery! Thanks Team ATI!

name: Dave Hammond
text: Great staff and very knowledgeable. Your success is their primary goal.

name: Phillip Perkins
text: The program they put me on is helping me with my condition. I would recommend them to everyone.

name: Morris Perry
text: My physical therapist Richard is amazing. I will definitely recommend him in you come into the North Trussville ATI Therapy location.

name: Randy Bryant
text: Always fantastic service and results.  Wouldn’t go anywhere else to keep me in the game.

name: Rodney Davis
text: They are very nice and friendly but emtirely to many patients per Therapist. They get things confused, forget about where you are in your activities, evaluation is very unclear and no clear instructions on what to do on your own once you leave.

name: Jay Moore
text: Physical Therapy with Richard has really improved my range of motion. He takes his time to make sure that I get back to 100% in record timing.

name: Hannah George
text: Can’t say enough good about the team at ATI Happy Hollow!! The PTs are knowledgeable, personable, hilarious, kind, and everything you could want in a physical therapy experience. Thanks to Beth, Alyssa, Kelton, Brian, Kacy (and Ryan!) for all their hard work and fun times!

name: Crystal Johnson
text: My daughter goes and she's 15 and she 💘 💘 love them

resp.text: Thank you for this positive rating!

name: Jennfier Powell
text: I would recommend ATI physical therapy to my friends and family.  The staff is courteous and understanding.  Everyone is friendly.  The place is clean and organized.  IF I ever have to have therapy again, I will be using ATI.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your positive experience with us!

name: Sudsy Warrior
text: I came here after my first surgery and was very nervous and quiet for the first few weeks but eventually I opened up and got to know all the workers and they are all amazing! Not only do they care about the patients and know what to do for every injury, they are also very kind and know how to make you laugh especially Ryan, Brian, and Kacy! I couldn’t recommend this place more 10/10!

name: David Simmons
text: If I could give 10 stars I would do it. This place is amazing, Brian, Casey, Ryan and the rest of the team are the best. They truly care about their patients, and no matter how busy they are, they are always so nice and do their jobs with a smile on their faces.

name: malachi roegner
text: Best physical therapy place I have been too and has the nicest and most helpful people like Brain, Casey, and Ryan they help you a lot and make your physical therapy experience much better.

name: Keli Fulcher
text: I have never had a positive experience with physical therapy until I began treatment at this location with Brian.  It is obvious he is very experienced and cares about his patients.  They don’t just give you simple exercises you can do on your own in the gym; but tailer a program where you will see results.

name: michael allison
text: Well the care may be good, but the fact you get put on hold and we will call you back SUCK"s, i am looking for my wife as we speak and can not find her, via cell phone or ATI answering service,  her appointment was at 4:30 it is now 6:48pm. I am not happy.

name: Amber McGlathery
text: Very nice and hard working!

name: Enloketa Farness
text: Great experience!! Tracie was awesome!! Kim is great too!!! Very dedicated to getting you back on the right track

name: Natalie Virciglio
text: They are great here. They really care about your recovery and getting you back to were you need to be

name: Jared Evans
text: Big b the brinator is excellent everyone there is top notch everyone is great highly recommend

name: Jackson Payne
text: Recommend for fast recovery and there is a little fun

resp.text: We appreciate your positive review about your recent experience with us! Have a great day!

name: Evgenia Kovda
text: Have taken really good care of my aged dad, many thanks to the caring staff.

name: Dinah Harper
text: Having to see my mom thru a window is heartbreaking due to CoVid19 but they are doing a wonderful job with their residents.

name: Misty Clift
text: Very clean, very friendly environment from the time you walk through the doors.

name: Suzanne Ray
text: My father was admitted one Tuesday for Rehab and I got a call on Friday morning that he was given another Patient’s medication ( 4 different meds). He was monitored at the ER and was discharged to home For home health PT. I was not going to give them another chance to harm him.

name: Susan Burgess
text:
My husband's cousin and Aunt are there. She is in the rehab just yesterday from the hospital after a bad fall. I saw a post from 2 weeks ago from an employee stating she loved her job and has been there for  4 years. Things have been good for  his cousin.
Praying his Aunt can recover.  All of our family appreciates the kindness that has been shown to out loved ones. It really means a lot.
Thank you so much! ❤️

Family appreciates

name: Emily Tinsley
text: Great place that provides great care!!

name: Tina Soper
text: I have worked there for 4 years and I love my job we treat each other like family even residents. I wouldn't work anywhere else.

name: Judy Brown
text: A cold day but pleasant experience

name: Ronald Wyers
text: These folks are so awesome, from the receptionists to the trainers. Very attentive, great listening skills. Concise plan and directions. Was skeptical but now a believer!

name: Laura L
text: I cannot heap enough praise about the physical therapists, staff and facility at St. Vincent’s. After undergoing a bad ankle break and surgery with hardware, I could barely walk and was in constant pain.  Tyler helped me through the process, from basic mobility exercises to advanced balance and strength training.  He was always so positive and encouraging, making a difficult and depressing time in my recovery less insurmountable.  I looked forward to my sessions at ATI – everyone was so supportive and friendly.  I also appreciated the variety of equipment (especially the blood flow restriction apparatus).   Motivating, energetic environment with skilled, compassionate staff all the way around.  Highly recommend x100!

name: Jennifer Kendall
text: ATI was extremely professional, flexible with my schedule, and overall very helpful. This was my second time using them. My husband and I both used to them two years ago as well and we would definitely Continue to use them in the future if needed

name: Edlue Tabengwa
text: From the initial consultation  about my proposed treatment plan to implementation of the treatment, the service was excellent. I also like that my assigned home exercise can be downloaded on the ITA portal, with models detailing how to perform each exercise correctly.

name: Henry Levens
text: My therapist is helping me to recondition myself and helping to relieve pain and swelling in my knee and lower limb.  She is very attentive.

name: Thomas Webb
text: Tyler is amazing.  I'am getting stronger & feel better with reducing pain level under his expert guidance.

name: Genece Bonner
text: The staff is very friendly, knowledgeable, & attentive.

name: Tonja Hooper
text: SARAH IS MY THERAPIST. I THINK SHE'S GOOD AT HER JOB DEFINITELY BROUGHT MY KNEE BACK TO LIFE . SHE HAS A MEAN KNEE MASSAGE THAT YOU WOULD COME  BACK FOR THANK YOU SARAH THE STAFF ALSO ARE GREAT GREETS YOU AS YOU ARRIVE I CANT SEEM TO STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE🌝

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your positive experience with us!

name: Becky Partington
text: Rita is so knowledgeable and explains all the exercises thoroughly. She is cheerful and gets me in and out on a timely basis so I can get to work on time.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your positive experience with us!

name: Eddie Jean Bankhead
text: The best evidence base right total knee replacement surgery you can as for!  Dr. Cain/Dr. Mouday and his team of physical therapists makes for the best come back to life’s journey.

name: Lawrence
text: Tyler who works at the physical therapy group was very helpful and really nice while I was doing my therapy a very respectable man.

name: Renee Davis
text:
ATI located on the St. Vincent's Hospital campus in Birmingham, Alabama is one of the best physical therapy facilities From which I have received rehabilitative care.  Sarah Schmidt is the best therapist with which I have ever worked.  I have worked with her on 3 separated occasions and she is an expert at what she does.

The facility is equipped with a well trained staff and is capable of any type of rehab work needed.    When you are a patient at this ATI clinic,  you're treated with dignity, respect, and concern.  There number one goal is your care, your progress, and  how you are feeling.  As long as Sarah Schmidt is there, I will continue to use ATI.

name: Valerie D Smith
text: The staff is very friendly, professional, knowledgeable and skillful. My therapist motivates and encourages me to do more exercises in between ATI visits.

name: George Lyde ii
text: The experience was on point I Iappreciate Tyler and secretary.

resp.text: It's so great to see this high star rating. Thank you!

name: Barbara Green
text: Very professional  and perfect strength building

name: GWEN R
text:
Steve (Therapist) is very helpful and knowledgeable with answering all of my questions and concerns. He is helpful in guiding me through all the rehabilitation exercises and stretches. When i experience pain he let me know why and insure me it will go away. He was right. I informed him of all my doctor visits, results, and we work from there.
He really care and want to see my performance get better. He is very personable and isn't afraid to touch and stretch my shoulder.
I would recommend ATI Physical Therapy at St Vincent in Birmingham Alabama  to anyone needing rehabilitation help. All theTherapist and the two Receptionist are very professional and helpful to me

name: Earlethea Coleman
text:
Superb services!!! Very knowledgeable of various exercises to help regain control of physical activity due to having surgery! Chris wanted us to say he’s the best, but we know who’s the greatest of all time “G.O.A.T”(Stephen) 😎!! Would recommend ATI Physical therapy St. Vincent’s (main campus) to anyone!! Glad we decided to come here!! Thanks Stephen for everything and working to get “Jr.”, as you call him back in shape in no time!!!
Signed one proud mom

name: Carrie Coleman
text:
The staff is friendly the place is clean I'm getting some relief with my problem
Thanks Tyler Weber

name: meta knox
text: I really appreciate the way the staff work with the clients. They show a very personal but professional way of working with us as well as encouraging us to be open about how we are doing. Everyone is polite. Thanks again everyone.

name: Lisa Bell
text:
Thank you so much for the wonderful care and treatment you are providing me during my therapy sessions,. With special thanks to Sarah and Andrew!! Due to my injury, my first feeling about therapy was fear, even before I began. But, THANK YOU Sarah, you truly calmed all of my fears on my very first visit!
You guys ROCK!!!

name: Rajesh Dill
text: Everyone is friendly and caring. Sarah, Madelyn and Rita all made me feel welcome and at home. Highly recommended for anyone whose trying to get the best physical therapy.

name: janice greer
text:
Everyone in this outfit is top notch. If I finish with an exercise and my therapist is helping with someone another therapist is there to help.
I have never had to wait and am always greeted with smiles and  a thank  all around. If I ever need PT again hands down this is the place.

name: Terry Pierson
text: I am Extremely pleased with my care at ATI.  I have been under their care for 6 months.  Everything is so well run.  I might add that I have never seen a disagreement among the staff.  Whoever is in charge does a great job managing the personnel.

name: shawn satterfield
text: Awesome experience!  I’ve been a patient for a couple of months now and am treated like a family member.  Just yesterday I recommend ATI St Vincent’s to a potential patient.  It is obvious the clinic director sets the example of genuine caring about patient outcome and her attitude permeates thru the entire staff, making the difference between a good clinic and a great clinic.

name: terri odum
text: Wonderful staff! They couldn’t have been kinder to my daughter through all this. So grateful for their positivity and care!!!

name: Suzy Ovson
text: I have found  ATI to be professional, yet relaxed.  The staff is friendly and always on the move to be there for me. I'm working with Chris who is great!

name: Rose Wellbaum
text: It was a great experience and they got me better, faster than I thought could happen. Super friendly and encouraging!

name: Wyatt Newman
text: Great staff! Came here after ACL recon surgery and thanks to them recovery has been great! High recommend!

name: Alycen Johnson
text: This clinic is amazing!! They are super flexible and work around your entire schedule!! Great quality care!! 💜

name: Palmer White
text: Awesome place with dynamic employees that make every visit very personal. I enjoy my sessions every week. I would recommend this place to anyone needing therapy.

name: Laurel Land
text: Too busy. People are fairly knowledgeable, bit it's nothing more than an assembly line.

resp.text: Hi, Laurel. Thank you for letting us know of your customer experience. We appreciate your input and value your comments. If you would like to speak with someone, or if you have any further questions or concerns, please feel free to contact our Patient Advocate Team at 1-(630) 296-2222, Ext. 7371.

name: Tyler Brandon
text: They are very helpful, informative, and personable about the injury you are there for. All of them are extremely knowledgeable of what needs to be done to help correct your injury.

name: Bryant Washington
text: Great staff, they have helped my son alot following his surgery.  Awesome experience and by far the best therapy crew in the State...

name: Derek Swindall
text: Everyone was welcoming, professional and knowledgeable about the treatment plan. Tyler was great!

name: Natasha Murphy
text: Awesome place and great people 💕

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your positive experience with us!

name: Elizabeth Brower
text: Excellent..many thanks.

name: chari britnell
text: Only came once for staple removal & evaluation by fellow from Andrew's Sports Medicine.  No wait and very courteous techs.

name: Dorothy Price
text: ATI in Roebuck is a great place if you ever need physical therapy. The Therapists are very knowledgeable, thorough and caring. I felt so much better within two days of treatment. Great place, great atmosphere, great treatment, great people. Overall great experience!!!

name: Lakisha Lewis
text: ATI is very clean & nice! The staff have great customer service! Everytime I go physical therapy makes me feel 10x better! Highly recommend 🥰

name: Melissa Burden
text: The facility is nice and clean. And the staff is super nice and very attentive to your needs and pain threshold. My visits have been very pleasant and would recommend them highly.

name: MELEESIA BURCH
text: Very nice place clean and therapist very professional and let's you work at your pace just all around courtesy I'm glad I chose ATI

name: Momma TikTok
text: This location has the best customer service I’ve experience in a long time. They are professional yet make you feel like family 💯 The receptionist has the most amazing smile and always has a kind word as you enter the facility. She became like a friend I’ve known all my life. Johnita my trainer exceeds all expectations I’ve ever had about physical therapy trainers . She truly goes above and beyond when caring for her patients. She is extremely knowledgeable in her field and I was honored to have her as my trainer. I highly recommend this establishment to anyone who wants excellent physical therapy 💯 Katie Boyce

name: Shennita Swain
text: I just want make a comment about the experience I had at the Birmingham - Center Point location. My physical therapy started 5/19/20 & ended 6/8/20 and I'm now on a path of recovery thanks to Ms. Williams. I injured my knee playing tennis but Ms. Williams helped improve and manage the pain I was experiencing - I dodged the bullet on having surgery.🙂 I would like to thank Ms. Williams for such an excellent job in doing what she does. Ms.Williams was very professional and highly knowledgeable. Also thanks to Ms. Javascia who contacted me for every scheduled appointment and maintained a high level of professionalism and customer service.  Thanks again to the Birmingham - Center Point office and the entire team of ATI for continuing to be part of the care of the people today.  Be safe

name: LASHAUN Snipe
text: Customer service was great. Physical therapist was awesome!!!

name: Brianna Cantrell
text: From the moment I entered the doors, the staff was professional and friendly. My PT Johnitia Williams was very knowledgeable and provided the best care. I left with better results that I could have even imagined. I would definitely recommend the services of ATI on Parkway East.

name: Nessa
text: The staff was very nice and professional.  I would recommend them to anyone that needs physical therapy,

name: Vic Churchill
text: My wife's therapist was awesome. Knowledgeable..Experienced..Patient..Friendly..recommend highly.

name: Wesley Smith
text: I just want say that the therapy really help me out I would like to thank Ms WIlliams  for her help I really appreciate her she is the best !!!!!!!!!!!!!!

name: Mary Poole
text: I like the staff they are very friendly and about their business.

name: Quintina Harris
text: Very kind and courteous really helpful.

name: Trina Vines
text: What an incredible place to live and work !!

name: Holly Hendon
text: The staff at Saint Martins are some of the kindest most compassionate people I’ve ever met. My father was very well taken care of the three days he was there. Thanks to Saint Martins I was able to sit with my dad while he passed even through the Covid Pandemic. I am very thankful these women helped me through my fathers last days.

name: Joe Watts
text:
Rating the Independent Living facility from 3 years ago, I would give it 5 stars. My mother-in-law was in the independent living for 2 months and it was everything we had hoped it would be.

After falling and breaking a hip, she went to the rehab side. It was like night and day. They were very understaffed. They would take 30 minutes to answer the call button when we were there. They would place the call button on the opposite side of the room in an unreachable location when we weren't there. They were told of this and we would leave notes explaining that she couldn't reach it. They continued to do it until we had her transferred to another location. I would give them 0 stars if possible. Locations like this seem to change regularly, so note that this is a review of the situation from 3 years ago. Everyone agreed that the food was always good, though....but the care itself left a lot to be desired.

name: Al Rhoney
text: This morning, I brought my wife and 3 other very close friends of a man whose been admitted here for end-of-life care. My immediate impression was very favorable. It was clean and quiet, with no "sanitary cleaning" odor. Upon entering one of the staff saw me and asked if she could help. She told me where we had to sign in and what Suite our friend was in. As we walked to his room,  his  nurse introduced himself and told us a bit the kind of care he was receiving and told us he  was available for any questions. Our friends room was very clean and neat. The lighting  was very comfortable and welcoming. We spoke with 4 staff members besides our friends nurse. Every one of them were very pleasant and offered their help, for anything we needed. I noticed a number of "little things" that had been done to help keep our friend comfortable. Things that I'm positive are helping him remain as comfortable as possible in his condition and demonstrate a deep level of genuine caring attitude from the nurses and staff. If I ever have a need to place a family member in an end-of-life Hospice Care facility, I would not hesitate to use St. Martin's in the Pines.

resp.text: Such kind words. Thank you for sharing.

name: Mike Baswell
text: We were very pleased with our experience at St. Martin’s in the Pines. Our family member entered via the Skilled Nursing unit and then graduated to Assisted Living.  Their services were critical to helping her to recover and return to Independent Living.

name: Jeff Williams
text: My Grandmother was a resident there several years ago. She received so-so care. Some of the employees were very nice and helpful, but a lot were just lazy. The woman in charge (I'll update if I can remember her name) is a liar. She would tell us what we wanted to hear, not the truth. The doctor that sees the residents is just a puppet for the the administrators. He does not look out for his patients. They sent my grandmother to the hospital for an evaluation and and once she was away, they used a loop-hole to evict her. Even though she passed the evaluation, was still independent and could function with minimal care. If you choose St Martin's, be sure to check on your loved ones often. I'm sure there are worse places out there, but there are better ones also. Note: This was several years ago so hopefully some of the same employees don't work there anymore.

name: Naomi Goodwin
text: I am the Assistant Director of Nursing at St. Martin's in the Pines. Working at St. Martins in the Pines has been a outstanding experience. This is a faith based campus with a very positive environment. There are so many great people working here and we all are like family here. The customer service and patient care is outstanding. We have some really great elder's and families that reside at our campus here at St. Martin's in the Pines. This campus has so much to offer such as rehab, long term care in our cottages, many levels of assisted living, and several levels of apartments The food here is outstanding.

name: Kywanniee Stuckey
text: St. Martin's is a great faith based and tight knit community. There is such a friendly atmosphere around the entire campus. The elders and their families are the greatest joy and blessing to be able to care for. Our pastoral team is remarkable; they keep the community grounded in faith and positivity! Not to forget, the food is amazing!

name: Tina Hawkins
text: Im so disgusted with management and how i was treated in the end. You should feel safe coming to work and free from harassment, but no one did anything to deal with an issue that happened my last day. It was a nice place to work until that point!

name: Foleca Swain
text: I first want to thank God for blessing me with this career @ St. Martin's in the Pines as MDS Coordinator. I could have been many places closer to home, but was chosen to drive a few minutes further. This was the best decision in my life, I have great administration, co-workers & most of all great Elders & sponsors. Thank you God for blessing me with the best last.

name: Anica McDonald
text: There is a reason why St. Martin's in the Pines has been around for over 60 years. Their commitment to excellent patient care along with genuine love towards the elders on the campus is why I am excited to come to work everyday. Faith is the foundation of who we are and that in itself speaks volumes. Come take a tour and see for yourself!

name: Lee Nocella
text: The quality of care at St. Martin's is inconsistent.  Most people there are very nice and helpful.  The food is also very good.  However, my elderly sister approached a group of employees at the nursing station for help with her husband who was in the rehab facility recovering from surgery.    They didn't answer the call light earlier and he needed to use the restroom. They were unwilling to help and told her they weren't "trained" for that.  They had been helping him prior to that as it was part of his rehabilitation not to mention his dignity.  My sister was offered absolutely no assistance and had to help him herself.   I called the nurses desk to get her some help and the person who answered didn't even bother saying hello but held the phone up in the air for a moment before hanging up on me.  They must not be trained to use the phone either.  Then, as we were leaving after an afternoon visit, the director of nursing came out to the parking lot and had a very non-hipaa compliant conference with us about my family member's care outside in the open in front of whoever happened to be walking by.  She tried to rationalize why the employees there would not offer to help my family member.  I was embarrassed for her and walked off.  My sister needed help.  Not one employee offered to assist her.  Any prudent compassionate person in a similar situation would have helped.

name: Sherryll White
text: Sounds like workers like to be there, the families of loved ones not so impressed. My MIL was there for rehab and the experience was not pleasant. Dirty, run down rooms, so so staff. They lost her pj's and eventually started to ignore her. Sept 2017.

name: nicole boomhover
text: St. Martin's is a great place to work! There is a friendly atmosphere on campus and the staff truly cares about the loved ones and residents. Come take a tour and see for yourself!

resp.text: Thank you for your dedication to St. Martin's. We are so glad you enjoy working here!

name: Cassandra Clark
text: St.Martins in the Pines is a great place to work. I am the Director of Social Services. Everyone is so friendly. Our elders and patients Rule!

name: Susan Melvin
text: A great place to work. Everyone is treated like family and they care deeply for their employees.

name: Steven S
text: A very good retirement community. Clean, nice and good location.

name: micki082
text:
EDITED!! Since posting this review, I've had a few lengthy conversations with a couple of the "head" personnel  at St Martin's. We have come to a mutual agreement and I am satisfied with the outcome. I am NOT removing or changing anything in my initial review, so one must proceed with care and make sure EVERYTHING is explained to you in its entirety.   ORIGINAL REVIEW: This is a LONG read, if I could rate with less than 1 star, I would, but this NEEDS to be shared!!! NEVER USE ST MARTIN'S FOR IN HOME CARE!!!!!!! I recently had to have major back surgery, and as I have no local family, I opted to use St Martin's "in home care".  I have NEVER used this type of service EVER, and I must say I was COMPLETELY taken advantage of and the service was HORRENDOUS . Because, I had never used this service,  I had hoped that they would understand my needs and assist me in setting this up. Oh they SET ME UP all right.  TWENTY FOUR HOUR SERVICE, even while I was in the hospital for TWO weeks.  The hospital did not let them do ANYTHING. (Hospital policy), so ALL they could do was SIT there, maybe assist in putting on those "stupid hospital socks" , cover me when I got chilled and uncover me when I warmed up. I had NO idea that I could PICK AND CHOOSE when I needed them. I was left with the impression that once I started their service, that I was STUCK with them until I was released by the surgeon.
I KNEW that I would need help once I returned home, but NOT 3- 8 hour shifts. I was in the hospital almost 2 weeks and during that time the program manager was to set up my in home care. I informed her that I did NOT want a parade of different faces coming into my home. TWO WEEKS, she had to get a "team" put together. THIS DID NOT HAPPEN!!! When I returned home; A DIFFERENT person almost every day AND some shifts not even covered. How could I heal, if I had to STRESS every day about my care?? This is MY home, I was not capable of moving around, so I couldn't very well see what was happening around my home. The 11pm till 7 am shift was the WORST! I did NOT require anyone to WATCH me while I slept, so I PAID A LOT OF MONEY for these sitters to SLEEP, WATCH TV, AND TALK/PLAY ON THEIR CELL PHONES while I slept.
I know that the sitters were supposed to be bonded/insured, BUT how did I know things weren't moving out of my house. YES, I have trust issues with strangers, but that is NOT the point. The POINT IS... The "Care At Home" program is NOT SET UP CORRECTLY, THE PROGRAM MANAGER IS OBVIOUSLY NOT WELL TRAINED IN HER DUTIES,( I heard that she hasn't been doing this long)  AND I, THE CLIENT,  feel TOTALLY abused and "taken for a MONEY ride".
I could rant on & on, but I AM DONE!! I truly hope that this review opens up some eyes at St Martin's AND future clients.  <1 star!! HORRIBLE! NO EXCUSE!!

name: Vontricia Prewitt
text: I hate this place for my granny. They need to be fired. Every last one of them on 2nd and 3rd shift.

name: Steven S
text: A very good retirement community. Clean, nice and good location.

name: cara vaughan
text: If I could give less than 1 star I would. This was 6 months of HELL!!

name: Elizabeth Grace Diggs
text: Everyone is very knowledgeable and personable. I feel like I am in good hands and well on my way to recovery!

name: lori cook
text: It’s important to trust your Physical Therapist to listen to you and discuss treatment before and after each session. Joe has earned my trust and respect and I wouldn’t place my healing in anyone else’s hands! He is the BEST!

name: Sara Moore
text: Everyone there is so friendly and knowledgeable. The facility is kept very clean.

resp.text: Thanks for the great review! Have a wonderful day!

name: Tom Hodges
text: Very helpful staff. New equipment. Getting positive results. Would recommend them and use them again if needed .

name: len gilardi
text: All the folks there are just the best. Besides being knowledgeable they make the hour fly right by. An added plus is that my lower back feels so much better.

name: Barbara Hoos
text: The staff at this location is on point! The customer service is phenomenal, these people seem to genuinely care about their clients. The facility is clean, and the team members go the extra “mile” to really get to know their clients by remembering names, acknowledging special events and taking care of each person’s special needs. Great job!

name: Steve Sherman
text:
Couldn't ask for a more friendly and professional group of people! Always walk away refreshed and
looking forward to the next appointment. May be in pain but it makes it a lot easier when ATI’s team of Therapist care about you and your next step to recovery!

name: Chrystal C
text: Just finished up my PT today and I have to say this place is amazing. The staff are all very nice, professional and they treat you like family.  The absolute best place to go for physical therapy. If you ever need PT for any reason definitely go here, you will not be disappointed.

name: Christopher Lloyd
text: Enjoy the nice and friendly workers that are understanding on each patience.

name: Enya Patterson
text: ATI staff are courteous and very informative. I am learning a lot about my condition and ways to prevent future injury.

name: Alan Talley
text: Great job by Joe and Mindy and all the staff at ATI in Oxford, Al!

name: Daniel Spaulding
text: I had 2 shoulders & both knees replaced. I credit the therapy I received at this ATI clinic for my great recovery! I appreciate the director, Joseph Mogill, and his wonderful  staff who treated me: Mindy, Tonya, Stoney, Riley & Derrick.

name: Berenna Reynolds
text: The therapists are very knowledgeable,  helpful,  and super nice!

name: Daryl Parker Sr.
text: People there are very professional, polite and helpful. I hope that in the future, if I need more therapy, that I be referred to ATI

name: bill cook
text: Very professional, knowledgeable and wonderful rehabilitation equipment and environment.  I would recommend to anyone needing physical therapy!!!!

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your positive experience with us!

name: Beth Scott
text: Staff is amazing! Thanks for all you do!!

name: jerrie lynn martin
text: My husband got sick yesterday and was unable to continue his therapy.  His therapists took great care of him inside and helped him to his vehicle.  She also called later to make sure he made it home ok and asked if he was any better.  Very helpful and concerned.  We appreciate it very much.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your positive experience with us!

name: Bailey Goode
text: Best place to go for physical therapy. I had surgery to replace my acl and for a top piece of my femur that was broken and I can already bend my knee past 90°. And pretty walk without my crutches! Staff is super helpful and they even showed us an electric shock therapy wrap we could get for home at no cost to us because it’s compatible with most insurances! I would definitely recommend Oxford, AL ATI to literally everyone. I’ve heard a lot of horror story’s about physical therapy offices but this office truly stands out amongst the rest!

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your positive experience with us!

name: Gail Cook
text: In early March, I had my second total knee replacement and I already knew just how important physical therapy is in the healing process. I appreciate the cheerful, caring and professional atmosphere, as well as, all of the encouragement, guidance and instruction provided by this amazing group of young professionals. The quality of care that is provided at ATI is excellent! Ryan, Joe, Tonya, Blaine and the entire ATI Team works diligently to encourage and help each patient in their recovery. I highly recommend Oxford ATI Physical Therapy! Many thanks to the Oxford ATI Team for helping me get my life back!

name: unit easley
text: Great experience...very friendly staff...very experienced

name: Nicholas Cook
text: The staff is wonderful and care about their clients. The facility is very clean, organize, and friendly. Each day the therapist strive to build strength, endurance, and flexibility while having your safety in mind, to keep   from reinjuring yourself.  I would highly recommend these guys in Oxford ATI.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your positive experience with us!

name: Debbie Walker
text: Very nice group of professionals!

name: Raynard Young
text: Friendly, up to date equipment

name: Alicah Long
text:
The staff here are spectacular!! They are very helpful and want the absolute best for you. They are very good encouragers and they motivates us to work harder!! If you don’t show up, they call to make sure everything is okay! (They are so caring!!☺️)
They treat us like family and take really good care of us. I especially love sharing my crazy stories with them and them being able to relate and tell me their childhood stories.
So, ATI in Oxford is the best place for you to get stronger and better with your injury!!! ☆

name: JOSEPH BEANE
text: Best physical therapy clinic in Alabama, hands down! Two of the therapists there, Ryan and Joe, do a great job of providing a comfortable environment for the patient while still providing the best care you can get! The entire staff is generous and I actually enjoy my therapy! They do an outstanding job of educating my family and I on everything that deals with the rehabilitative process and I can tell that they genuinely care about my overall well-being! If you sustain an injury, or need somewhere to go post-operation, come here!!

name: Di in Dixie
text: ATI and Ryan Huff make an awesome team. Ryan treats his clients with kindness, compassion and with dignity. When you walk into ATI you are greeted with a big smile from the entire staff. After I had therapy for a broken foot, I knew that Ryan Huff was the therapist for me. Since then I have been diagnosed with Parkinson’s Disease. The program for people with Parkinson’s is wonderful. It helps the stiffness and ridigity that come with PD. I may not go in with a smile, but I assure you that I always leave with one. Thankful to Tonya and Joe and the entire staff.

name: Dr. Patrick Harrison
text:
ATI of Oxford exemplify true dedication to being the best in their profession.
I have worked together with both Jared Waits and Ryan Huff on numerous occasions and the concern for their patients is second to none.
These guys truly understand how to work together with all professions for the common goal of improving each individuals quality of life.
Call on them when in need, they never disappoint!

name: Jorie Ross
text:
This is my second day and I can tell you, this is the most wonderful place to go for physical therapy.  The physical therapists are knowledgeable and so friendly.  They make you feel like you accomplish so much.  It is worth the 2 hour drive.  Love...love...love
SO FREAKING AWESOME!!!!!!

name: Amanda McCormick
text: Tonia is awesome! She is caring, and tough. She will push you to do your best.  She helped my daughter to be able to love her life to the fullest. My daughter refuses to use any one else.

name: Lisa Hatz
text: Wonderful Therapists and PTA.  Ryan is super accommodating.  Always worked around my my work schedule.  Tonia is so sweet and professional. I would highly recommend  ATI to anyone who needs therapy.

name: Freida Groce
text: Very professional and friendly. Always encouraging too. I came in a wheelchair and I am walking with a slight limp but I am positive that in a couple of months that’ll be gone 🙏🏽

resp.text: We are happy to hear about your positive experience! Thank you.

name: John Smoak
text: Joe and the other therapist at ATI have really worked hard to help me get better. They are very knowledgeable and always positive and friendly.  I really love going to see them for my therapy and appreciate all they have done to help me.  ATI in oxford is the absolute best!!

name: Tiffany Triplett
text: I had a great experience at ATI. Joe made sure I felt comfortable since I have anxiety with crowds but I never once felt overwhelmed. Everyone was so amazing and nice and I will miss my therapy sessions but they did such a great job that unfortunately I am done. I will 100% recommend ATI to everyone.

name: Paige
text: As a mom and a former college athlete I wanted to be able to perform fully in both every day activities and sports after my ACL surgery. Jared Waits took my performance goals into consideration during my rehab, and I really appreciate that. He was always positive with me, always took my questions and concerns seriously, and helped me not just to return to every day function but also to return to sports. I hope I never get injured again, but if I do I would choose ATI and Jared again.

name: kathie cleghorn
text:
My first experience with Ati Oxford was 6 months ago after shoulder surgery and now after my knee replacement. Ryan, Joe, Tonia and Blaine are awesome. You receive the best of care in a facility with a wonderful atmosphere full of encouragement.
I will forever be grateful for my recovery through ATI.

name: Richard Shipman
text: I had 2 shoulders rebuilt in 2018 and 2 different sessions of therapy on them that lasted into 2019. My therapist both times was Jared and because of him,I was able to come back to work within 3 months of the surgery ( with each shoulder) I actually looked forward to going to the therapy because of him. If I ever need any therapy in the future, I want him to be my therapist.

name: Kaiser Mitchell
text: Had physical therapy with a guy name Jared. He was good dude helped me recover from an rotator cuff injury I had. Also taught me a lot of useful things about my body along the way. Would recommend!

name: Joseph Roberts
text: Great facility and workers that make you feel like family. Highly recommend using them! Made recovering from my surgery so much easier.

name: Danelle Lindo
text: I had torn my ACL and it being my second time I knew that rehab was going to be vital. I had the pleasure of being helped by Jared Waits. He was amazing and very knowledgeable! He’s very personable and made my whole rehab experience a lot more fun!

name: Lee “ThunderWolf” Stone
text: I've been to other physical therapy facilities but none compare to the personal caring treatment you receive at ATI...The whole staff is very friendly and caring...my main therapist are Tonya and Joe...they're awesome!! First things out of their mouth is how are you feeling...is your pain any worse...they care and work on the areas that you need healed...I couldn't ask for a better team to help me through reducing  the pain I carry...I'm sure they're not miracle workers but they have helped me when I thought hope was lost...give 'em a try...you'll be happy with your results...

name: Sandra Trego
text: I have been in different therapies for over 30 years and ATI Oxford is without a doubt the BEST!  Ryan Huff, Tonya Wright, Joseph Mogill and all the others are to be commended for their care to each and every patient. They are professional in every way but totally friendly. I highly recommend this clinic to everyone!

name: Christy Kochie
text: Great staff who genuinely care about you! They helped me and my daughter recover from a car accident. I would definitely go back if I needed to.

text: After 3 knees replacements and numerous scopes and mother surgeries I can spot a great physical therapy team. This is one at ATI at Doug Baker. They are the best

text: Everyone at this ATI location has been professional, knowledgeable, and genuinely concerned for my total knee rehab! They have become friends even as they maintain their professionalism. I am on my way to a full recovery in a relatively short time, thanks to T, Krystale, Drew, Cory, and Barbara Ann, who mans the front desk. They truly do exceed my expectations every day! What a team!

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your positive experience, Sharon!

name: Glenn Shaull
text: Professional and courteous staff providing top notch care. I highly recommend if you need PT services.

text: ATI at Lee branch Is great. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. I’ve been to other facilities but ATI is the best by far. I love working with Atiba Callens. I can’t say enough good things about him.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your positive experience with us!

name: Leigh Laatsch
text: The type of patient care demonstrated by ATI Physical Therapy is exceptional!  I am so grateful for the meticulous attention given to my recovery from shoulder surgery. My physical therapist, Paige, asks very good questions and listens well to my responses. Because of her knowledge base and professionalism, she is able to determine the best solution towards rehabilitation. The culture at Lee Branch ATI Physical Therapy is consistently encouraging and friendly! Each staff member participates in the process of healing to ensure the best possible outcome for complete restoration. I highly recommend ATI Physical Therapy and I am thankful for everyone there who has been a part of my journey!

resp.text: Hi, Leigh. We are very happy to have provided you with such a positive experience! If you have any further questions, please give us a call. We're always happy to help!

name: Mark Cubine
text: Went here for my rehab from total knee replacement.  Very happy with the choice of this facility and their staff.  It is well equipped, very clean, and the staff are all first rate professionals.  I got the encouragement, coaching, and direction I needed to get back to life and work as quickly as possible.  I would go to this place again without any hesitation if I ever needed PT.  Staff was so professional, I owe a lot of my quick and complete recovery to the work done by Paige, Krystal, Dru, T, Aaron,and the rest!  ATI at Lee Branch is highly recommended.

name: Susannah Edwards
text: From the very first appointment, when I had to leave suddenly after arrival, ATI has been so amazing! They rescheduled me quickly, and I have been for five sessions now. I love my therapist, Morgan, but all of the staff has gone out of their way to meet me and talk to me. If I have to do PT, I am super glad it’s with ATI!

name: Linda Dawson
text: Excellent therapist, compassionate, thorough and easy to talk too. T explains why he is is asking me to do certain exercises and how they will help me in the long run. Very professional.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your positive experience with us!

name: Brandon Scordino
text: Easily the best, caring PT crew I've used in Birmingham

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your positive experience with us!

name: Anthony Robertson
text: Was with this ATI for a knee and back recovery. Couldn't be happier with all the services they provided. Every single person there will make your recovery process smooth and enjoyable even through the pain!

name: Michael Brooks
text: The staff here are so friendly and kind. My brother had to have physical therapy after his ACL surgery and has recovered and is back to playing Baseball in college at Lawson! Thanks team!

name: Haden Frost
text: Love A A Ron and Stephanie, my foot is getting better due to their help!! 100% recommend

name: Lee-Anne Hall
text:
Atiba Callins and the entire staff at ATI are fantastic! Everyone is professional and highly skilled. They take the time to get to know each patient personally and create a therapy plan specially fit for each individual. They are so welcoming and friendly and make physical therapy as enjoyable as possible.
My son injured his Achilles playing baseball, and physical therapy was prescribed. This was the first time we’ve ever need physical therapy and we so surprised by the difference it makes. While my son was being treated, I was able to observe the team in action, and I was so impressed. After some rest and physical therapy, my son is back in action, and I’m so grateful for Atiba and everyone at ATI for playing a key part in his healing and being so encouraging and kind.

name: Will Pfaffman
text: All I could have asked for in physical therapy. Nothing but friendly people and great service. They helped me to get back from a torn acl. I would highly recommend.

text: Very professional and thorough. Friendly staff

text:
Front desk staff very cordial, helpful and friendly.  X-Ray a great team.  Dr. Savage takes the time to explain what’s going on and what is necessary to get on the road to recovery. I have no hesitations in recommending him.  Truly a very good Orthopaedic surgeon with the patients best interest and care as his primary goal.
A great experience with a capable staff.

resp.text: We're especially grateful for the recommendations of our patients to others - thank you Theodore!

name: Arthur Wallace
text: Jennifer a lot better than the last specialist I went to (not Bayside) for other problem. Didn't show X-ray no explanation of anything. At least Jennifer was explicit with X-ray and all other info. GOOD NURSE
